newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Mostly flat debuts for new issues.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Mostly flat debuts for new issues.

text.p: Companies making their market debuts met with mostly lukewarm demand on Wednesday although analysts says stronger deals are expected next week.

After putting its IPO on hold during the July rough season, EarthLink Network Inc finally made it public. The company offered two million shares which priced at $13 a share, below its estimated pricing range of $14 to $16. The shares were flat at $13 in afternoon trading.
CD Warehouse Inc, which franchises and operates stores that sell, trade and buy new and used compact discs, shares were flat at $5 after their IPO debut.
The Oklahoma City-based stock priced at the low end of its pricing range of $5-$6.25. Capital West was the lead underwriter of the offering.
Another music company, Paradise Music & Entertainment Inc, went public offering one million units for $6 each.
Like many of the other deals priced for trading today, it priced at the low end of its estimated range of $6 to $7 each.

The company makes original music scores for television, radio and movies and produces music videos and specials. It also manages music artists through a company called All Access, which manages Carly Simon, Daryl Hall and John Oates, and other including the Screaming Headless Torsos, according to its prospectus.

SEEC Inc shares posted slim gains, rising to 9-5/8. It was the sole offering today that did not reflect weakness at its pricing, at a cost of $7.25 a share from its estimated range of $6 to $7.50 each.
HC Wainwright & Co Inc was the lead manager of the 1.8 million-share offering. SEEC provides software for legacy COBOL software applications and related databases.
Printed circuit board maker Eltek Ltd crept up 1/2 to 5-1/2. The 1.5 million shares of the Israeli firm priced below their estimated pricing range of $6 to $7.
